lines.text:
[Tape of his phone call to the police]
Oh my God! Oh my God! My twin brother has been shot! I think it was an Asian gang or something... There was this guy, he looked Asian... and he was speaking another language, I'm pretty sure it was... Asian.

You were never there for me were you mother? You expected Mike and Carol Brady to raise me! I'm the bastard son of Claire Huxtable! I am a Lost Cunningham! I learned the facts of life from watching The Facts of Life! Oh God!
Free cable is the ultimate aphrodisiac.
Dos thus have thou a mug of ale for me and me mate, for he hath been pitched in battle for a fortnight and has the king's thirst for the frosty brew dos thou might have for thus!
You know, my brother is a speech therapist.
Tho?
HI! Is there a problem with your service?
Yeah, my cable is out.

[Presents a cut cord]
Really? So you call me? Ha, funny how you call when you NEED something. Is that how you treat people?
This concludes our broadcast day. Click.
Call it one guy doing another guy a solid.
That is so nice!
Well you're a nice guy! You'd be surprised how many customers treat me like snot, like I'm a goddamn plumber or somethin'.

The future is now! Soon every American home will integrate their television, phone and computer. You'll be able to visit the Louvre on one channel, or watch female wrestling on another. You can do your shopping at home, or play Mortal Kombat with a friend from Vietnam. There's no end to the possibilities!

[Chip had hired a prostitute to entertain Steven]
Just get out. I don't ever want to see you again. Robin is never going to forgive me!
DON'T TELL HER.
Cable Guy!

[in the shower]
Oh, shit!
Caable Guuuy!
I'm coming!
[grabs a towel, heads for the door]

[yells]
Caaable guuuy!
Don't leave!
[Steven reaches the door, peeks outside]

[leaving, sounding angry]
Jesu Cristo!
Can I get a knife or fork?
There were no utensils in medieval times, hence there are no utensils AT Medieval Times. Would you like a refill on that Pepsi?
There were no utensils but there was Pepsi?
Dude, I got a lot of tables.

You might recognize this song as performed by Jefferson Airplane, in a little rockumentary called "Gimme Shelter," about the Rolling Stones and their nightmare at Altamont. That night the Oakland chapter of the Hell's Angels had their way. Tonight, it's my turn.
You're right. That's incredibly insightful.
I know. It was Jerry Springer's final thought on Friday's show.
The blue knight rules! The red knight sucks the big one! Down, down, down. Right knight goin' down. Down, down, down. Red knight goin' down.
Preferred customer my ASS!
Quickly, muster atop your steed. Buddy, get on the friggin' horse. I don't think he's kidding.

[on answering machine]
I was just blow drying my hair, thought I heard the phone ring. Ah... has that ever happened to you? Anyway... call me, we'll talk about it.
Reality isn't 'Father Knows Best' anymore. It's a kick in the face on a Saturday night with a steel-toe grip Kodiak work boot, a trip to the hospital, bloodied and bashed, for reconstructive surgery.
Hey, wait, come back!
Well look who decided to show.
You were supposed to be here 4 hours ago.
Was I? So I'm the tardy one?
Yeah, I was gonna go to that bed and bath place and now it's closed.
Well maybe I shouldn't have come at all, JERK OFF! I'm just jokin' with ya.
I can be your best friend or your worst enemy. You seem to prefer the latter.
You know what the trouble about real life is? There's no danger music.
What a place for an ending, huh? It's like that movie 'Goldeneye'!

[On Steve's Answer Phone]
Awwwww shit.
Sounds like heart break to me.
Well I really don't want to discuss it with you. Could you just install my cable please? I'm gonna go get dressed.
Suit yourself. No sweat off my sac. Oh by the way, you might wanna put on a bathing suit 'cause you'll be channel surfing in no time!
If Robin had seen you tonight, she'd be begging you to take her back. I'm telling you, these knights get laid all the time.

[He and Steve are on horses about to charge one another]
This is our destiny!
No it's not!
Yes it is!
No it isn't!
Yes it is!
Isn't!
T'is!
Isn't!
T'is!
Hang in there, pal! You're gonna make it, buddy.
Hey!
[helicopter paramedic learns forward]
Am I really your buddy?
Yeah, sure you are.
[an evil grin spreads across Chip's face]

[on answering machine]
Hey man. It's me again. I was just taking a whizz. Thought you might have called. Okay, later.
It was my treat.
What do you mean it was your treat?
You know, I bought this time. You buy next time... Don't let your eggs get cold.
Buy what?
What do you mean 'buy what'? The women.

[after pause]
Do... do you mean that Heather is a prostitute?
Of course she is. You think a woman like that would hang out with us if we weren't paying her?
The cable guy is missing in action.
[talking with Rick on the phone]
Apparantly he is gonna be here between eight a.m. and my death.
Look, Chip Douglas, I don't know what your story is, but I'm going to find out!
Well, don't dig too deep or you might get burnt by the molten lava!

Women are a labyrinth, my friend. Can I be frank? I don't think you listen to her. I think you tell her what she wants to hear. She wants you to thirst for knowledge about who she is, all the complicated splendor that is women. When your love is truly giving, it will come back to you ten fold.
You're right. That's incredibly insightful.
I know. It was Jerry Springer's final thought on Friday's show.

[using Cable Guy's advice to Robin]
I don't listen to you. I pretend to understand, but I'm really just saying the things that I think you want to hear. And I'm interested in learning about every detail of the complicated splendor that is you.
Oh.
Pretty smooth work! I set 'em up, you knock 'em down.
What?
Robin. I got her back for you. I juiced her up!
How do you know we're back together?
Free cable is the ultimate aphrodisiac, Steven.
I don't want you messing with my life!
I know! I felt bad about the other night. I wanted to make it up to you.
[pause]
So what are you doing? Wanna catch a flick?

Look, I appreciate you helping me out with Robin. But you have to understand. I'm going to have to work *extra* hard to not screw this relationship up again. You're a very nice guy, but I just don't have any room in my life for a new friend. Okay?
So, what are you trying to say?
I don't want to be your friend.
I have this friend and he gave his cable guy $50 and then he got all the movie channels for free. You ever hear of anything like that?

[Walks slowly towards Steven]
You mean illegal cable?
Um... Yeah.
Who told you that? What is his name? I want it.
Just forget it.
You're offering me a bribe. What you have just done is illegal and in this state, if convicted, you could be fined up to $5,000 or spend six months in a correction facility!
No, please, that was dumb. I was just making conversation. Forget it.

[Bursts out laughing]
I'm just jerking your chain! Ha ha ha. The look on your face! Ha ha, you are too easy!
[laughs harder]
Wake up, little snoozy. Smell the smelling salts? Ha ha ha. I'll juice ya up.
Wow, the old McNair place. Never thought they'd get the floors clean after what happened.
Why? What happened?
They had a lot of cats.
Come on Stevie, time to leavey, It's the fun bus man!
Hey Steve I'm on a pay phone, so if you're there pick up, pick up, pick up, pick up, pick up, pick up, pick up, pick up, well OK, call me back.
Dry land is not a myth. I've seen it. Kevin Costner. Waterworld. I don't know what the big fuss is about. I saw that movie nine times. It rules!
I'll juice ya up.
Come back here, so that I may brain thee!
He who hesitates, masturbates.
Wake up lil snoozy! Smell the smelling salts!
I got you the big screen TV, deluxe karaoke machine, and THX quality sound that would make George Lucas cream in his pants!
Here is a comment card. Please mail it in when I am done.
Does this go to your boss?
No it goes to me, I'm sort of a perfectionis... perfectionis... t.
I forgive you. I only hope my neurologist will feel the same.
You better buckle up. I've had a lot to drink... just kidding. That's my humor!

[Steven punches him]
You're gonna have to do better than that, Steven. Steven. St-st-my lisp is gone!
[Steven punches him again; lisps]
You thtupid thon of a bitch!
[the Cable Guy makes a slam dunk and breaks the glass panel above the basket]
I love this game!
Hey, Rick! I never made a slam dunk before. Thanks for the boost.

[eating chicken at Medieval Times]
Can I have your skin?
Sure.
Check this out.
[places pieces of chicken skin over his face]
Silence of the lambs!
[imitates Hannibal Lecter]
Hello, Clarice. It's good to see you again.
[bursts out laughing]
Oh lord.
Dammit. Son of a bitch! The cable's out.
What's going on?
It appears that we're going to do battle, Steven.
Is this a normal part of the show?
No, but I gave all the knights free cable. They thought it would be cool if we went at it for a while.
Is it safe?
Sure, that's what the armor's for. Come on.
You know, I'm embarassed to say this but I don't even know your name.
You really wanna know my name? You do?
Sure.

[after pause]
It's Ernie Douglas. But my friends call me Chip.
[Smiles at Steven]
Um... Goodbye.
Don't be mad. Can't you get somebody else?
Sure. Maybe I'll take MY cable guy.
Cable guy!
[pounds on the door]
Cably Guy? Cable Guy!
[Rings the buzzer]
Cabla goobla!
What are you doing?
I'm just talking trash.
You ruined the game.
I don't appreciate your tone, Steve. Friends aren't supposed to talk to each other that way...
What are you talking about? We're not friends. I don't even know you.
Well let's change that. Let me buy you a Heineken.

[signaling the waiter]
Excuse me, excuse me, pardon me, pardon me, pardon me, hey what's the story with our chicken, man? Have the eggs had a chance to hatch yet? Maybe you can go check on it for me, my friend, if it's not too much trouble for you.
[the waiter walks off]
Okay, I'm sorry to put you out.
[Turns to Robin]
See the attitude?
I hate you! Get out of my life!
He's projecting all of his anger onto me. Maybe I should go.
No, don't go. Steven, you are being an asshole!
[Steven is in jail]
Hello, Steven, I came as soon as I could.
What's your real name?

It's Larry Tate, but that's not what's important right now. We have to get you out of here. I was watching Court TV and I found a loophole in your case. I'm gonna talk to the judge about a writ of Habeas Corpus. I'll put the SYSTEM on trial.
Why are you doing this to me?
I didn't do this to you, you did this to you.
[Chip is danging over a ledge above the giant cable dish]
You'll be fine. I'll be your pal, just come on up!
No. It's too late for me, but there are alot of little cable boys and girls out there who STILL have a chance! Don't you understand, Steven? Somebody has to kill the babysitter.
[drops from ledge and freefalls towards dish]
Guard! This is the guy who framed me. He set me up. Arrest him!
Hey Bernie, how's that sports package?
[Bernie gives him a thumbs up]
All right!
I just wanna hang out. NO BIG DEAL!
Murray Slaughter, George Jetson, Jean Luc Picard, there's even a guy who liked to be called "The Big Ragu".
Carmine from Laverne & Shirley.
That's so sad that you know that. Anyway, the cable company has just fired somebody six months ago named Darrin Stephens. You may remember his boss, Larry Tate, from a little show called Bewitched.
So... He doesn't even work for the cable company.
Yahtzee! They booted his ass for stalking customers. This guy is deeply troubled. If I were you, I'd lock up *tight*.
[they are playing Porno Password - the password is "Vagina"]
Penis. Penis. Penis...?
Vagina?
YES! She said "vagina"! She said "vagina"!
I would've said "schlong".
Great. Now we're starting to get this.
[playing Porno Password - the password is "Nipple"]
Hard...
Erection?

[sighs]
No. But thanks for noticing.

[after Steven has jumped on to the latter]
Nice jump, Spider-Man!

[his first lines]
Caaaaaaaable guuuuuuy!
[the police arrive at the satellite dish]
[mock terror]
Uh-oh, Steven called the fuzz! "Bad boys, bad boys... whatcha gonna do?"
Don't you get it? Someone has to save all the other cable boys and girls, someone has to kill the babysitter.
I asked my girlfriend to marry me and she asked me to move out.
